intro: Antitoxicum minus, commonly known as the lesser antidote plant, is a rare and elusive species native to the temperate regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant contains unique alkaloids that have historically been studied for their potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution and fragile ecosystem, it is considered endangered and protected in several countries. Its botanical significance lies in its potential contributions to pharmacology and botanical science.
